result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Antonio Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Antonio Williams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Antonio Williams was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 407 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid Joint and Several to Steven H. as a condition of Extended Supervision. To be paid before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with any victim or witness or co-defendants listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 04/04/16 sentencing hearing.
Associated with Charge #7

Defendant Anthony Antonio Williams in court, in custody, with Attorney Chris Bailey.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bailey makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #7:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 407 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  30 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - obtain HSED/GED
____No contact with: victims/witnesses or Co-Defendant's listed in criminal complaint 
____Not to use or possess any weapons
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $1,650.30 - Joint and Several to Steven H. (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on April 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
(Fax) Dated 03/14/16, from Atty Bailey to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment of 03/31/16 hearing.
Sentencing hearing at 03-31-2016 10:00 am
Filed by the State. Witness list attached. (Received on 08/12/16)
Sentencing hearing at 03-24-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Anthony Antonio Williams in court, in custody, with Attorney Chris Bailey.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #7 on information filed on 3/27/15.    Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #7.  Count #6 is dismissed outright.  Counts #8 & 9 are dismissed and read-in.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Attorney Bailey requests bail modification.  State objects to request.  Court denies request.   Bail remains as fixed. Sentencing hearing date set.

Defendant Anthony Antonio Williams in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective David VanElls was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit 1 and 2 marked. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. Exhibits are received. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments and moves to dismiss. Court denied. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
